      What does it even mean to multiply something by zero?

10.30.17  3:00 pm   I'm not particularly suggesting you do this.. but I'm curious what your thoughts are on this (I'm assuming you've thought about it before). When you're trying to the 2 week schedule thing, why not post the song (just the audio) on your website when that's finished, as opposed to waiting for the video to be done as well? Do you think the video is more effective/enjoyable if it's a song we haven't heard before? Like, do you think us knowing the song before the video comes out would be like 'spoiling the surprise' or whatever? People liked the movie star video even though that song was posted before the video. Again, I'm not particularly suggesting you do this. Just curious why you've decided against it? 

     i think it makes for a much stronger release if they both come out at the same time

10.30.17  2:59 pm   Is this next video a song?

     yes

10.30.17  2:58 pm   Soooo... video this Wednesday right?

     i wish

10.30.17  1:36 pm   What's it called when you divide the beats into 6 equally spaced hits, like if the time signature is still 4/4 but instead of playing 16th notes you play 6 (instead of 4) for each beat? I'm guessing they're not called 24th notes lol. How would you write that out?

     well, computer programs actually sometimes do call it 24th notes, just because it's consistent, mathematically. But, ... in writing it is usually called some type of triplet or sextuplet. in your situation, i would prefer to call it "16th note triplets" for clarity's sake, although i'm sure people would just say 'sextuplets' and assume you know what they mean. i prefer to write it as a group of 6 notes, double beam, except only a single beam between the 3rd and 4th notes. so 2 groups of 3 16th notes, connected in the middle by a single beam. you can put the triplet arc (and number 3) over each group of 3. or if you want i guess you could put one arc over the whole thing and put 6. that works too, i guess. i hope that answers your question

     i think so

10.30.17  5:34 am   Do you sometimes answer questions vaguely because you just don't have time to answer every question in detail?​

     no, that's just to delay people from finding the ones i answered in way, way too much detail

10.30.17  5:28 am   Still irked with the q being misplaced like that.

How long would it take me to get used to it?

     i was used to it immediately, so i'm not sure

10.30.17  4:43 am   Which questions in particular are answered helpfully and phylosophically?

     you will have to check and see!

      Why all the other questions get ridiculous answers?

     after answering 25,000 questions or so, it becomes important to have a bit of fun. actually, who am i kidding, fun has been intentionally an important ingredient to this questions page ever since the beginning.

     I see many people here who want from you some help but you answer with detached cruelty

     i hope it's not cruel. but with so many questions coming in it is not possible to answer all of them with the in depth essays that i sometimes provide. also i don't think that would be a good reading experience, to have too many dense answers

10.30.17  12:54 am   If you were to give a name to the current chapter of your life what would it be?

     trying to do the 2 week thing

10.30.17  12:42 am   Do you make all these questions yourself to feel loved?

     no

10.29.17  10:21 pm   constructed languages are real. they were just made up by people instead of developing naturally. sure, constructed languages often don't have that many speakers, but that doesn't make them any less real.

     "real" can mean different things depending on the situation. for example, valid bank notes vs counterfeit. you might say "is this real" well of course it's real, it's a real piece of paper, but given the context there could be a different implication
